<a id="class_BitMap"></a>

# BitMap

**Inherits:** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

Boolean matrix.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A two-dimensional array of boolean values, can be used to efficiently store a binary matrix (every matrix element takes only one bit) and query the values using natural cartesian coordinates.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_BitMap_method_convert_to_image"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Image](class_image.md) **convert_to_image**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_convert_to_image)

Returns an image of the same size as the bitmap and with an [Format](class_image.md#enum_Image_Format) of type [Image.FORMAT_L8](class_image.md#class_Image_constant_FORMAT_L8). ``true`` bits of the bitmap are being converted into white pixels, and ``false`` bits into black.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_create"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **create**\ (\ size\: [Vector2i](class_vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_create)

Creates a bitmap with the specified size, filled with ``false``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_create_from_image_alpha"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **create_from_image_alpha**\ (\ image\: [Image](class_image.md), threshold\: [float](class_float.md) = 0.1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_create_from_image_alpha)

Creates a bitmap that matches the given image dimensions, every element of the bitmap is set to ``false`` if the alpha value of the image at that position is equal to `threshold` or less, and ``true`` in other case.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_get_bit"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **get_bit**\ (\ x\: [int](class_int.md), y\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_get_bit)

Returns bitmap's value at the specified position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_get_bitv"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **get_bitv**\ (\ position\: [Vector2i](class_vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_get_bitv)

Returns bitmap's value at the specified position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_get_size"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](class_vector2i.md) **get_size**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_get_size)

Returns bitmap's dimensions.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_get_true_bit_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **get_true_bit_count**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_get_true_bit_count)

Returns the number of bitmap elements that are set to ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_grow_mask"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **grow_mask**\ (\ pixels\: [int](class_int.md), rect\: [Rect2i](class_rect2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_grow_mask)

Applies morphological dilation or erosion to the bitmap. If `pixels` is positive, dilation is applied to the bitmap. If `pixels` is negative, erosion is applied to the bitmap. `rect` defines the area where the morphological operation is applied. Pixels located outside the `rect` are unaffected by [grow_mask()](class_bitmap.md#class_BitMap_method_grow_mask).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_BitMap_method_opaque_to_polygons"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](class_array.md)\[[PackedVector2Array](class_packedvector2array.md)\] **opaque_to_polygons**\ (\ rect\: [Rect2i](class_rect2i.md), epsilon\: [float](class_float.md) = 2.0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_opaque_to_polygons)

Creates an [Array](class_array.md) of polygons covering a rectangular portion of the bitmap. It uses a marching squares algorithm, followed by Ramer-Douglas-Peucker (RDP) reduction of the number of vertices. Each polygon is described as a [PackedVector2Array](class_packedvector2array.md) of its vertices.

To get polygons covering the whole bitmap, pass:

```
    Rect2(Vector2(), get_size())
```

\ `epsilon` is passed to RDP to control how accurately the polygons cover the bitmap: a lower `epsilon` corresponds to more points in the polygons.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **resize**\ (\ new_size\: [Vector2i](class_vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_BitMap_method_resize)

Resizes the image to `new_size`.

<!-- classref-method -->
